result.execSummary:
The defendant Rick L. Ostermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Sample.
Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rick L. Ostermann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rick L. Ostermann in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:58 am.  State gives plea agreement, plea to charge, withheld sentence 1 year probation, costs, Counseling appropriate by agent. DNA Sample & Surcharge.  Atty Grubofski & def. agrees with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charge & penalties.  Ct. 1 Theft, no contest plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understand elements. Atty Grubofski is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to Theft. State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Grubofski gives sentencing recommendation.  Def. makes statement.  
Court orders withheld jail sentence 1 year probation, costs, $200 DNA Surcharge & DNA Sample, Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. No credit.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Rick L. Ostermann in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court will receive not guilty plea.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Rick L. Ostermann in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an attorney.  State request signature bond.  Bond set by court.  Def instructed to report  to jail for prints  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
